applications.name: Mozilla Firefox
applications.description: Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser focused on privacy, customization, and standards compliance. Firefox includes robust accessibility features, extensive add-on support, and built-in tracking protection for enhanced privacy.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and T together to open a new blank tab and place focus in the address bar for entering a URL or search term.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new tab opened and address bar focused. New tab appears at end of tab strip.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and N together to open a new Firefox window with a blank tab.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new window opened. Useful for separating different browsing contexts.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and P together to open a new private browsing window that doesn't save history or cookies.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce private window opened. Enhanced tracking protection enabled. History not saved after closing.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and W together to close the currently active tab and switch to the adjacent tab.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce tab closed and read title of newly focused tab. Can undo with Ctrl+Shift+T.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and W together to close the entire browser window including all open tabs.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce window closing. All tabs in window close. Session can be restored from history.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Q together to quit Firefox completely, closing all windows and tabs.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Firefox closing. All windows close. Can restore session on next launch.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and T together to reopen the most recently closed tab in the order they were closed.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce tab reopened and read page title. Press repeatedly to restore multiple closed tabs.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and N together to reopen the most recently closed window with all its tabs.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce window reopened. Restores entire window including all tabs from previous session.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Tab together to switch to the next tab in the tab strip or by recently used order.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new active tab title. By default switches to recently used tab. Change in settings for sequential navigation.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Tab together to switch to the previous tab in sequence or history.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous tab title and URL.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and a number from 1 to 8 to jump directly to that numbered tab position in the tab strip.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce selected tab title. Numbers correspond to tab positions left to right.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and 9 together to jump to the last tab regardless of total number of tabs open.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce last tab title. Always jumps to rightmost tab.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Page Up together to move current tab one position to the left in the tab strip.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce tab repositioned. Visual organization only.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Page Down together to move current tab one position to the right in the tab strip.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce tab moved. Useful for organizing related tabs together.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Home together to move current tab to the first position in the tab strip.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce tab moved to beginning.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and End together to move current tab to the last position in the tab strip.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce tab moved to end.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and M together to mute or unmute audio from the current tab without closing it.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce audio muted or unmuted. Prevents media from interfering with screen reader speech.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Left Arrow together to navigate back to the previous page in the current tab's browsing history.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous page loading and read title when loaded. Standard back navigation.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Right Arrow together to navigate forward to the next page in browsing history.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce next page loading. Only works after going back.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Home together to navigate to your configured Firefox home page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce home page loading. Home page can be customized in Firefox settings.

shortcuts.description: Press F5 to reload the current page and refresh its content from the server.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce page reloading. Shows updated content or fixes loading errors.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and F5 together to reload page while ignoring cached content, downloading fresh resources from server.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce page reloading. Forces complete refresh. Slower but shows latest version.

shortcuts.description: Press Escape to stop the current page from loading, displaying whatever has loaded so far.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce page loading stopped. Useful for slow pages or stopping redirects.

shortcuts.description: Press Space bar to scroll down approximately one screen height on the current page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce visible content. Standard method for incremental page reading.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Space together to scroll up approximately one screen height on the page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce content as viewport changes.

shortcuts.description: Press Home to scroll instantly to the top of the current page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce top of page. Visual scroll only, screen reader cursor position may not change.

shortcuts.description: Press End to scroll instantly to the bottom of the current page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce bottom of page. Quick way to reach page footer.

shortcuts.description: Press Page Down to scroll down one full page height on the current web page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce new visible content. Standard page navigation.

shortcuts.description: Press Page Up to scroll up one full page height on the current web page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce content as page scrolls upward.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and L together to place focus in the address bar and select the current URL for easy editing or replacement.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce address bar focused and read current URL. Type new URL or search term.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and D together to focus the address bar, alternative shortcut to Ctrl+L.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce address bar focused. Same function as Ctrl+L.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and K together to focus the search bar for searching with your default search engine.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce search bar focused. In modern Firefox, address bar also functions as search.

shortcuts.description: Type URL or search term, then press Alt and Enter to open it in a new background tab while staying on current tab.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new tab opened in background. Current tab remains active.

shortcuts.description: Press Up or Down Arrow to navigate through address bar suggestions including bookmarks, history, and search suggestions.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce each suggestion. Press Enter to open selected suggestion.

shortcuts.description: Navigate to an address bar suggestion and press Shift and Delete to remove it from history.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce suggestion removed. Cleans up unwanted autocomplete entries.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Up or Down Arrow to cycle through available search engines while typing a search query.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce selected search engine. Choose from installed search engines.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and P together to open print dialog for printing current page or saving as PDF.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce print dialog opened. Navigate options and select printer or PDF output.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and S together to save the current page to your computer as HTML or complete web page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce save dialog. Choose location and format for saved content.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and F together to open find bar at bottom of page for searching text on current page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce find bar opened and focus in search field. Type term and use Enter or F3 to find matches.

shortcuts.description: Press F3 to jump to the next occurrence of the search term on the current page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce match number and may read surrounding text. Cycles through matches.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F3 together to jump to the previous occurrence of the search term.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous match. Navigates backward through search results.

shortcuts.description: Press Forward Slash to activate Quick Find mode for searching text without opening full find bar.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Quick Find active. Type to search, highlight disappears after few seconds of inactivity.

shortcuts.description: Press Apostrophe to activate Quick Find Links mode for searching only link text on the page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Quick Find Links active. Type link text to highlight and navigate to links.

shortcuts.description: Press Escape to close the find bar and return focus to page content.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce find bar closed. Highlights removed from page.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and U together to open new tab showing HTML source code of the current page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce page source opened. Useful for developers to inspect page markup.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and I together to open Page Info dialog showing metadata, security, permissions, and media.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Page Info dialog with tabs. Navigate tabs with Ctrl+Tab.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Plus Sign together to increase zoom level making page text and images larger.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce zoom percentage. Helpful for users with low vision.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Minus Sign together to decrease zoom level making page content smaller.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce zoom percentage. Fits more content on screen.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Zero together to reset zoom level to default one hundred percent.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce zoom reset. Returns page to normal size.

shortcuts.description: Press F11 to enter or exit fullscreen mode hiding browser interface and showing only page content.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce fullscreen mode. Press F11 or Esc to exit fullscreen.

shortcuts.description: Press F9 to toggle Reader View which removes clutter and displays article text in readable format.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Reader View active. Simplified layout improves readability and removes distractions. Not available on all pages.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and D together to bookmark current page, opening panel to edit name and choose folder location.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce bookmark panel opened. Edit name and select folder, press Enter to save.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and D together to save all open tabs as bookmarks in a new folder.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce folder creation dialog. Name folder to organize related tabs together.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and O together to open Library window showing all bookmarks for organizing and searching.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Library opened with bookmarks. Search, organize folders, and edit bookmarks.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and B together to toggle bookmarks sidebar on left side of window for quick access.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce bookmarks sidebar shown or hidden. Navigate bookmarks with arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and B together to toggle visibility of bookmarks toolbar below address bar.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce bookmarks toolbar shown or hidden. Provides quick access to frequently used bookmarks.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and H together to open history sidebar showing recently visited pages organized by date.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce history sidebar opened. Navigate with arrow keys, search history, or clear data.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and H together to open Library window showing complete browsing history.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Library opened with history view. Search and manage browsing history.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and J together to open Library showing downloads list with recent downloaded files.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce downloads window. View, open, or clear downloaded files.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Delete together to open Clear Recent History dialog for removing browsing data.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce dialog with options. Select time range and data types to clear.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt to temporarily show menu bar with File, Edit, View, History, Bookmarks, Tools, and Help menus.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce menu bar visible. Navigate menus with arrow keys. Press Alt again to hide.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and F together to open File menu with options for new windows, tabs, and page actions.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce File menu opened. Navigate with arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Comma together to open Firefox Settings page for configuring preferences and options.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Settings page opened. Navigate categories in sidebar and settings with Tab.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and A together to open Add-ons Manager for managing extensions, themes, and plugins.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Add-ons Manager opened. Enable, disable, configure, or remove add-ons.

shortcuts.description: Press F12 to open Firefox Developer Tools for inspecting HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and debugging web pages.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Developer Tools opened. Advanced tool for web developers with multiple panels.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and K together to open Web Console showing JavaScript errors, warnings, and logs.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Console opened. View JavaScript output and errors for debugging.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and C together to open Inspector with element picker for selecting page elements to inspect.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Inspector active. Click elements to view HTML and CSS in developer tools.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Z together to open JavaScript Debugger for debugging scripts and setting breakpoints.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Debugger opened. Advanced tool for JavaScript development.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and F7 together to open Style Editor for viewing and editing CSS stylesheets.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Style Editor opened. Edit CSS and see live changes on page.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and E together to open Network Monitor showing all network requests and responses.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Network Monitor opened. View resource loading times and network activity.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and J together to open Browser Console showing all browser and extension messages.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Browser Console opened. Shows Firefox internal messages and errors.

shortcuts.description: Press Tab to move focus forward through interactive elements like links, buttons, and form fields.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce each element type and label. Standard keyboard navigation method.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Tab together to move focus backward through interactive elements.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous element. Essential for accessible keyboard navigation.

shortcuts.description: Press Enter to activate the currently focused link, button, or other interactive element.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce activation such as link activated or button pressed.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Enter on a focused link to open it in a new background tab.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new tab opened. Current tab remains active.

shortcuts.description: Press F7 to toggle caret browsing mode displaying a movable text cursor for selecting text with keyboard.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce caret browsing enabled or disabled. Navigate and select text using arrow keys. Press F7 again to toggle off.

shortcuts.description: Press Arrow keys to move text cursor character by character or line by line through page content.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers read text as caret moves. Hold Shift while moving to select text.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and A together to select all text in current text field or all content on page with caret browsing.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce all content selected. Use in editable fields or with caret browsing.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and C together to copy selected text to clipboard.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce text copied. Standard copy operation.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and X together to cut selected text from editable field and place on clipboard.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce text cut. Removes text while copying to clipboard.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and V together to paste clipboard content at cursor position in editable field.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce text pasted. Inserts previously copied or cut content.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Z together to undo last text editing action in editable field.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce undo. Reverts most recent change.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Z together to redo previously undone action.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce redo. Restores undone change.
